column4: Hi, can someone tell me a little about Ubuntu tree structures?
I am a newbee, and I need to find the kernel sources, i just cant find em
I'm trtying tio install vpn client
if you have downloaded them from synaptic they will be in /usr/src
I looked and it is downladed, but does not show up, even as hidden
for example, if you downloaded the kernel-source-2.6.10 from synaptic, there should be /usr/src/kernel-source-2.6.10.tar.gz there
there is nothing in that directory. I checked synaptic, and it says installed
it was installed when the whole system was installed
linux-image does not include the sources.
I'm new at this, how can I install the sources? I'm need it to install vpnclient from Cisco
yes. start synaptic and click search. type in "kernel-source" and press ok. choose which source you want and install it.
it says it is already installed. Do I just do it again? Sorry for being so ignorant
what is already installed? be precise
